body.p:
His Excellency
Gov Thos E Bramlett

Your petitioner Joanna Bell woman of color states that in the day of the last May term of the Jefferson circuit court she was arraigned on a charge of Larceny, tried convicted & sentenced to a term of two years in the Ky state prison. The case is as follows-

Crow, a discharged negro soldier desired the girl Bell to go with him to Lexington & promised her all his money if she would do so. In accordance with this proposition the girl assumed control, or rather obtained possession of the money. Crow went immediately went to the Police and had her arrested. After being arrested she gave up the money, which Crow has received- The case is one of a great deal if merit ^of^ which she should receive the full benefit & not suffer on the evidence of a single negro, uncorroberated save by the officer making the arrest & who could only testify as to information given by Crow & not to facts of the taking- In addition to this said Joanna Bell is now pregnant, a period of some three or four months of gestation having passed- which makes her a burden to the state for nearly the whole time of her sentence- The clemeny & mercy of your Excellency is humbly asked in the above case- In accordance with the law Joanna Bell is now confined to the Frankfort Penetentiary-
We the Undersigned think the foregoing Petition one in which your Excellencys pardon is fully merited-

J D Duncan
F G Dannecker
Selby Harney
J D Harrington
R. H. Caldwell
James RobSmith

Jefferson Cir Ct
vs
Joanna Bell
